intro: Aulomyrcia rubella var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth-flowered aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its habitat.
